intro: Gossypium transvaalense, commonly known as Transvaal cotton, is a flowering plant species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces fluffy, cotton-like fibers that are harvested for textile use. It thrives in warm, arid climates and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique adaptations, it plays an important role in the ecological balance of its native habitats.
